newsitem.title: USA: Spice says won't pursue more lawsuits.
newsitem.headline: Spice says won't pursue more lawsuits.

text.p: Spice Entertainment Cos Inc said Monday it will not pursue more lawsuits about Section 505 of the 1996 Telecommunications Act.

A company spokesman said Section 505 required cable operators to scramble spillover audio and video clips from adult television programming. If an operator did not have the technical capabilities to do that, it was required to carry the adult programming between 10 p.m. and 6 a.m.
Spice said it decided to stop challenging the constitutionality of Section 505 after the U.S. Supreme Court recently chose not to hear its request for a temporary restraining order on the measure.
Spice said it spent more than a year challening the measure.
The company said it will instead focus on maximizing cable operators' revenues from its two adult cable services, Spice and The Adam & Eve Channel, within the regulated adult television environment.
